Guhasīva：King of Kālinga.

At first he did not pay honour to the Tooth-relic of the Buddha which was in his capital，but later，having seen a miracle，he became a Buddhist and paid the relic all homage.

Later，he sent the relic to Ceylon，through his daughter Hemamālā and her husband Dantakumāra．The whole story is given in the Dāthāvamsa （chap.iv.ff）.
